MAN.TITLE: READC_f
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: Scicos "read from C binary file" block

DESCRIPTION.P: This block allows user to read datas in a C file. Output record selection and Time record Selection allows the user to select data among file records.
Each call to the block advance one record in the file.

ITEMIZE.label: DIALOGUE PARAMETERS
ITEMIZE.ITEM: : an empty matrix or a positive integer. If an integer i is given the ith element of the read record is assumed to be the date of the output event. If empty no output event exists.
: a vector of positive integer. [k1,..,kn],The kith element of the read record gives the value of ith output.
: a character string defining the path of the file
: a character string defining the format to use

: for reading respectively long, ashort, unsigned long, unsigned short, double, float, char and unsigned char. If required by the swap mode, the bytes which are read are automatically swapped if necessary (by checking little-endian status) in order to produce machine independent binary files ( in little-endian mode).
: can be used for reading respectively unsigned little-endian long or short and unsigned big-endian long or short.
: with x=b or x=l can be used for reading double, float, long or short as big or little endian.
: The file is supposed to be formed by a sequence of data with same format. these data are organized in a sequence of record each of them containing Record size data.
: To improve efficiency it is possible to buffer the input data. read on the file is only done after each Buffer size call to the block.
: a scalar. This fixes the first record of the file to use.

: With Swap mode=1 the file is supposed to be coded in "little endian IEEE format" and data are swaped if necessary to match the IEEE format of the processor. If Swap mode=0 then automatic bytes swap is disabled.
